attributes.action: remove the deposit levied on candidates standing for the post of Elected Mayor.
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
The post of Elected Mayor is a local government apointment so why should there be a deposit of £500 put upon it. This sum prevents local independent candidates from standing for Elected Mayor but allows anyone rich enough to be able to lose such a sum still to stand. It also biasts the election towards political parties and away from independent candidates. No other local government elected position carries a deposit so why should the Elected Mayor?
NB: This does not include the Elected Mayor of London.
